topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a4ed316368723a3d970000#post_53a4ed316368723a3d970000
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a4ec0e6368723d55ca0000#post_53a4ec0e6368723d55ca0000
Not at all. Harry Potter is probably one of the most overhyped things ever. I've met people who start bleeding from the eyes if you so much as insinuate that the HP series had any flaws.[/bq]
I may really like harry potter, but I'll admit it has some serious flaws.

Immediate problem 1) Why the fuck weren't they working on getting rid of the Hocrux's until after Voldemort revived? . . . Seriously; in the over a decade of Voldemort being dead there was only a handful of still active death eaters that knew of the hocruxes and was still trying to bring him back.  Even if it took them years to find hocruxes and destroy them that would still be either all of them gone or enough that gone that Voldemort when revived would be forced into hiding to prevent anymore from being destroyed.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a4ef696368723bc9670100#post_53a4ef696368723bc9670100
And I'm sorry, retconning Harry's dad into a dick for the soul purpose of appeasing Snape fangirls is the dumbest shit I've ever seen.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a4ef696368723bc9670100#post_53a4ef696368723bc9670100

The problem amounts to this. I'm not against a villain whose tries to go against the concept of Death. 

But why did Voldemort chose such special objects to hide his soul?! He could have chosen a friggin river stone and toss it in the middle of the Atlantic.

Why didn't he used the Imperio curse to make the parents kill the baby and then themselves?!

There's Pride before the fall, and then there's just being dumb
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4
